perturbation.original_text: 22.4 Governing Law. The construction, interpretation and performance of this Agreement and all transactions under it shall be governed by the law of the State of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules, and both Parties consent to jurisdiction by the courts of the City of Haifa.
perturbation.changed_text: 22.4 Governing Law. The construction, interpretation and performance of this Agreement and all transactions under it shall be governed by the law of the State of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules, and both Parties consent to jurisdiction by the courts of the City of Haifa, except that any dispute resolution shall be subject to mutual agreement by both parties at the time of the dispute.
perturbation.explanation: The added phrase contradicts the previously stated agreement to jurisdiction in Israeli courts by allowing for mutual agreement on dispute resolution at the time of the dispute, thus creating uncertainty regarding which legal framework will govern.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflict of Laws principles, Contract Law (certainty of terms)

perturbation.original_text:
10. Express Limited Warranty
For the purpose of this Agreement, "Warranty Period" shall mean twelve (12) months as of the date of delivery to Customer. Contractor represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be free from defects in workmanship, material (only to the same extent as the original manufacturer of the material warrants the Contractor), and manufacture; (ii) will comply the Specifications IPC610.B standard (in all material respects and unless otherwise was instructed by Customer). Contractor further represents and warrants that the Product will consist of new materials.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Express Limited Warranty
For the purpose of this Agreement, "Warranty Period" shall mean twelve (12) months as of the date of delivery to Customer. Contractor represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be free from defects in workmanship, material (only to the same extent as the original manufacturer of the material warrants the Contractor), and manufacture; (ii) will comply the Specifications IPC610.B standard (in all material respects and unless otherwise was instructed by Customer). Contractor further represents and warrants that the Product will consist of new materials, unless explicitly directed otherwise by the company.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of "unless explicitly directed otherwise by the company" introduces an exception that undercuts the promise of new materials, effectively giving Contractor the ability to not use new materials based on internal directives, negating the original warranty. In the event that the company explicitly allows for the use of old materials it can be argued that the contract is broken.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Warranty Law, Contract Law (certainty of terms)
